TOP!!!
I LIKE IT A LOT!

Everything the first Portal did right, this game expounded on.  Everything is improved upon: level design, character development, animation, voice acting, story, puzzles, soundtrack, the portals themselves.  Even the most obvious plot twists are so well executed through the scenery and lighting and acting and animation and literally everything that you can't help but feel shocked.  GLaDOS and Wheatley will steal both the show and your heart.  Co-op is so much fun, and this is coming from someone who is normally staunchly adamant about hating playing with other people.  Help me, space cops, space cops, help.

Again, much like with the first game: if you haven't played it in awhile, play it again.  If you've never played it, buy it now and play it.  You'll be Wheat you did.  Shoot, the pun doesn't work with his name.  You'll be GLaD you did.  There, that's better.

Still can't find the darn cake, though.

Portal 2 is my favorite game of all time. I have great memories playing this around once a year after I got it. The story is fantastic. The puzzles are clever. The graphics still hold up, and the animations are better than most other AAA games that I've seen. Co-Op is really fun. Making your own maps adds tons of value. The community is fantastic. Thank you Valve for making such a masterpiece of a game.

GLaDOSæˆ‘è€å©†ï¼

[b]*Review written after 11 hours of gameplay - achievement percentage = 75%*[/b]

(75% means the main story line. The rest (Co-op) is omitted.)

- Portal 2: A conflict between the dominant robot and the recessive human. Now with twirling plot twists.
- Awesome story - with nothing told too much. You must "puzzle" it together - as always. ;)
- The "portal gun" and the "puzzles" are joined by other advanced/original mechanics - not present in Portal.
- The puzzles are very good and challenging: You must - more as ever - think out of the box to solve them. 
- You can beat the game under 5 hours. 
- For its quality, it is worth the money. In my opinion, it's one of the most awesome games ever. A must.
- I really loved the ending and you'll also do!

- You have my recommendation - for Portal and for Portal 2!

GREAT GAME! It's funny, it has good story telling ETC the second best Valve game by far. The first one was good but this was great. But if you're not into Puzzle games or funny and witty humor then I can't recommend it to you, but for the rest of you, once you get done with the main story you can play CO-OP! Really well executed and I think it might further the story more. After that you can play ALL the custom Levels you want CO-OP included.

Co-op on this game makes it a must play. 

Hours of laughter and fun when playing with friends.

Glados is also one of the best in game bosses ever made.

Portal 2 es una secuela que le hace justicia al juego original. La evoluciÃ³n entre el primer Portal y esta segunda entrega se nota muchÃ­simo (y para bien). Tenemos una historia mucho mas pulida y desarollada, giros siniestros con secretos creepys de por medio, una jugabilidad original, desafiante y con mas implementaciones tales como los lasers, liquidos y rayos de gravedad, un buen modo coop, un buen motor grÃ¡fico (y muy bien optimizado), personajes carismaticos y, como no podia faltar, canciones que le dan un cierre perfecto al juego. Si jugaste al primer Portal, entonces este te va a encantar, porque, como dije antes, Portal 2 es el claro ejemplo de que no siempre las secuelas son malas/inferiores a sus entregas originales

PDS: La torta sigue siendo mentira

PQP que jogo sensacional, delicioso, parecia que eu tava comendo aqueles hambÃºrgueres gigantes enquanto eu jogava de tÃ£o gostoso. Nossa. JOGUEM MEUS LINDOS!

Portal 2 is what me and many others consider as a perfect sequel. It takes the great mechanics and puzzles from the first game and makes them trickier and really brain taxing. It takes the little amount of story from the first game and completely revamps it into a real story, with amazing writing and twists. I can't even think of a single flaw with the game. It is a true masterpiece and most truelly one of the best video games ever made.

Portal 2 - 10/10

Further deepens the story and adds more interesting levels and mechanics.
The workshop and co-op gives the game unlimited replayability.

NEED PORTAL 3. NEED MOAR PUZZLES
Wish Gaben could count to 3 so we could get Portal 3.

I loved the game when I started playing it. There is more story/narrative from the start than the first game had (so it held my attention longer). The puzzles were more difficult but also more fun and it felt like there was more reason to play other than just to solve puzzles. I enjoyed the new aspect of goo being added. At first I thought the Lower Aperture level was a little boring but while replaying  (although long) it has been providing some intriguing story/backstory content that I enjoy greatly.

My only complaint with the game was that it is a little too linear. I usually play games that are more sandbox style where you do whatever you want, so I was disapointed I couldn't just abbandon Wheatly when I first had him (I didn't realize his plot to the story unil later but I didn't like him telling me what to do). I understand you have to follow the path the creators make, but I would have at least liked some reactions to other decisions before having to follow the main path again. Still, it would have been nice to have no one in charge of Aperture by the end.

Here's to hoping for a third game!
